intro: Costus guanaiensis var. asplundii, commonly known as the Guanaiensis costus, is a perennial herb native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and other tropical plants. The plant features erect, sword-shaped leaves and produces striking yellow to orange inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies in tropical ecosystems.
